storyName: Bear Witness, the Death of the Gods
storyInfo: Priestess shows the information contained within Originium to the Cautus Infected—past events that Priestess witnessed, revealing a glimpse of the threat to civilization.

attributes.content: We peruse and interpret the past and future of our civilization, as a monk seeks a revelation from his god.
Humans enjoy talking about the possible futures for their civilization, do they not?
At first, we flaunted what little vestige of truth we managed to grasp, and attempted to converse with the 'gods'.
We were answered with silence.
Then, we began to observe the fates of our own kind—
Some were less advanced than us, some slightly more so... in the end, what we learned was that death was the inevitable end of all the creations of nature.
And so humanity inferred that this was the revelation the gods never spoke.
In an instant, we thought we had grasped the truth of the universe.
attributes.name: Gentle Voice

attributes.content: We carefully 'monopolized' the revelation gained through sacrifice, and preached the inevitability of doom with so-called optimism.
attributes.name: Gentle Voice

attributes.content: 'Death is the inevitable end of all the creations of nature. All we can do is to leave behind the truth before our doom.'
attributes.name: Gentle Voice

attributes.content: You've lived on that ship for some time, and come to know some adorable lifeforms. Do you agree with this assessment?
attributes.name: Gentle Voice

attributes.content: You don't agree with the Presence?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: I respect them.
attributes.name: Gentle Voice

attributes.content: They were great people, but most of them were simply fools slightly smarter than the others.
attributes.name: Gentle Voice

attributes.content: Why are you asking me this? And... why have you brought me here?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: We were in that corridor just a moment ago.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Here or there, it makes no difference.
attributes.name: Gentle Voice

attributes.content: You have too many questions, questions that this place can answer.
attributes.name: Gentle Voice

attributes.content: What is this place?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: The graveyard of civilization's memory.
attributes.name: Gentle Voice

attributes.content: Towering statues made of unknown materials stand upon the vast expanse.
Ripples spread outwards in every direction, up towards the sky beyond the dark clouds, and down towards the grey-white ground.
Out in the vastness of the universe, civilization was born, like a drop of water falling into the ocean, leaving ripples in its wake.
attributes.name: Gentle Voice

attributes.content: They cross paths, love, hate, and eventually die.
attributes.name: Gentle Voice

attributes.content: The ripples of dead civilizations are forever etched upon this tombstone. Even after the bright stars of the forebears who inspired so many that came after them are long gone—
attributes.name: Gentle Voice

attributes.content: They still leave behind an incomparable impact on the universe. It is the ripples they left behind that form this land upon which we stand.
attributes.name: Gentle Voice

attributes.content: Their legacy fosters new civilizations, which in turn leave their own traces upon the universe.
attributes.name: Gentle Voice

attributes.content: But it seems... broken? Like a tree trunk snapped in half.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: You're not the first to describe it that way.
attributes.name: Gentle Voice

attributes.content: Once, someone very important to me said the same.
attributes.name: Gentle Voice

attributes.content: An absolute, ultimate presence tirelessly reaps the branches that sprout from this poor trunk, yet we know nothing about It.
attributes.name: Gentle Voice

attributes.content: What you've shown me is like... a miracle...
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: You saved me... from disintegration...
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: ...God.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: 'God'?
attributes.name: Gentle Voice

attributes.content: I'm just a humble linguist attempting to explain the universe.
attributes.name: Gentle Voice

attributes.content: My name is Priestess.
attributes.name: Gentle Voice

attributes.content: And, strictly speaking, I did not save you.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Your death has already occurred. I did not intervene in the process of matter being converted to information.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: But material destruction is not true death. Information is not so easily erased, and your information was stored in Originium.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: B-But I can think. I felt I was living when I was on the ship. All this vivid—
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: A stream of data repeated over and over.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I intentionally left behind fragments of history in order to observe our past lives.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: So this is like a dream?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: 'Dream' is vague and subjective. Do not allow language to lead you to meaningless self-doubt, before you have touched its fundamental nature.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: You may understand this as a snapshot from the past that I have recorded in the form of information.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: But it's nothing more than a still frame. There is no future for it.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Then why am I here?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: I saw you at the instant of your death.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Someone disturbed me. It was a coincidence, a whim of probability.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: So... I'm not special.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Oh but you are, Hierda. You, and those like you, are very special.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Originium has shaped you into what you are. You have interacted with Originium in wondrous ways.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Your history and your civilization all exist because of Originium.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: But Originium has also brought so much pain...
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Yes. It was a mistake. Your existence was not part of the plan.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: What?!
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Do you mean that the people on Terra shouldn't exist?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: No, you misunderstand.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Your civilization was born of probability. Just like you, standing here right now, it exists in time on an objective basis.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Born of probability, and lost to probability. It is the most basic rule of the universe.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: The Cautus needs time to digest it all.
Originium brought destruction to her, but also consolation and infinite knowledge in this frozen time.
She feels lonely, but no pain. If there is one thing right now that could cause pain, it would be—
Terra... my home...
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: It was not blessed by God...
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: She turns around to look behind her.
The land stretches as far as the eye can see, rippling like mountains extending infinitely.
She cannot see the end, nor any trace of Terra.
But she knows that the land is just within reach, if she only stretched out her hand.
Terra.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Is it doomed...?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: The 'god' looks up at the megastructure and does not answer.

attributes.text: Does that future you're always talking about really exist?

attributes.content: Doctor, be careful!
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Originium activity in this area far exceeds Dr. Kal'tsit's estimations. Originium crystals are growing at a breakneck pace...
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Plus those strange enemies that keep appearing—
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Yet your attention is drawn to the Originium in front of you.
Every shard, every facet...
Reflects the same scene in your eyes—

attributes.options: Her silhouette appears on every facet.

attributes.content: I am curious about you, Hierda.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: From here, I can observe everything of your world. You are the second being from this civilization to interact with me.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Do you still love your so-called 'great land'?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I think so... yes...
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Even if the pain that it brings you is real and inexorable?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Yes...
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Is this what concerns you?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I... I'm not sure what you mean.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Only praise for life and the indomitable will. Death has not overcome you.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: You came to me in search of an answer regarding the future. We stand now before that answer—
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: One that cannot be described by language.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: —What is it?!
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Remember that absolute, ultimate presence I mentioned?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: It was once thought to be light from a distant star.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: The Cautus looks up almost instinctively. Dark clouds cover the sky, blanketing the plain in darkness.
Then, a faint light breaks through a crack in the clouds. Looking upon the light, masses of people cheer and exclaim.
The Cautus feels as though she were among those masses.
I'm witnessing—
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: History.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Then, the ray of light bursts into a rainbow spectrum, as though the universe were painting upon a black canvas.
In their last moments, the pious souls continued to pray to the mysterious blessing of the universe.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: The people of reason, the scientists, they boarded their flying machines and flew into the light, hoping to touch the truth up close.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: (There's no movement? Why isn't anything happening, now that they've gone into the light?)
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: The idealists, the conservatives, denounced the enemy for invading the space that had belonged to them from their first moment of sentience.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: They brashly directed their most dangerous weapons towards the prismatic sky.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: The gentle light accepted all, neither exploding nor fighting back.
The light followed its determined path, ignoring the agitated souls beneath, though chaos and death had already begun to spread amongst them.
W-What's happening?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Do you want to go into the light?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: The Cautus feels her vision climb upwards, over the agitated crowd, over the burning mountains, over the dark clouds.
She can almost reach out and touch the rainbow light.
Weapons powerful enough to destroy an entire planet fly past her into the light without a sound. Ships that can sail the stars fall powerlessly to the ground.
They resisted.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: They prayed.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: They tried to sway the cold light with all things bright and beautiful that they had created over millennia—
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: But the light was unwavering, cold like deep space.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: The light passed over the planet and left. All was silent.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: The Cautus finds herself gazing into deep space, at the broken remains of the celestial body.
It is like the sight that the Presence was gazing at, that she was curious about, when she gazed upon the Presence.
It's... all gone... why?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: From whence did the doom come? Why did it come? Did it leave? Where did it go? What happened to all the lives—
Then she sees it.

Only broken remains are left upon the ruined surface of the planet, when the light of the star once again shines upon it. The planetary fragments break through the bonds of gravity and scatter to infinite space.
It was once a flourishing civilization that marked those fragments.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: No one could ever be prepared for It.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Even the wisest, most knowledgeable sages of this civilization had hoped for some premonition, some warning before the coming of the doom.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Unfortunately...
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: The Cautus witnessed the death of the gods, the powerlessness of the gods. For a moment, she even forgot how to fear.
Is this... the history that you experienced?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: No. It's simply one of countless fragments that we captured.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: This single glimpse could hardly compare to what I experienced for myself.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: The answer that you seek is not yet complete. Listen to the sounds that emerge from the ruins.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: The rocks that come from deep space—
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Comets. Sometimes, they are the bringers of the seed of life; other times, they do little more than fill the silence of a dead planet.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Where do they come from?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Anywhere, perhaps even another destroyed planet, the marks of a lost civilization still etched upon it.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: The gravity of the dead planet begins to draw in guests from deep space, and it begins to be made whole again.
Those ships floating in deep space—
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Explorers, seekers, colonizers, perhaps even plunderers, coming from far away.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: They, too, accelerate the evolution of civilization.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Do you mean that's what happened to Terra?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Your greed has gotten the better of your fear.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: What you learn cannot be unlearned, Hierda. Having glimpsed a vestige of truth, are you willing to go back into the darkness of ignorance?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: The Cautus continues to stand before the imposing 'gravestone'.
She touches the ripples upon it and trembles.
Every mark is the end of a civilization... only now do I truly feel—
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Can I stay here and learn?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: You have shown me the key to the answer. I have to comprehend all this knowledge on my own.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Even though this is only a fragment of time, frozen forever?
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: ...Yes.
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: You're very much like us.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: You may roam this place and anywhere on Rhodes Island freely, to seek the answer that you crave.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: As for whether you want to stay here, or go back to the Terra that you loved so much...
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: I will respect whatever choice you make. We will meet again soon.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: Y-You're leaving? Where are you going?
attributes.name: Hierda

attributes.content: Someone has been waiting for me.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.content: ...For far too long.
attributes.name: Priestess

attributes.text: Unauthorized 3rd-party plugin deleted. Default settings restored.

attributes.content: I've received your inquiry, Closure.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: PRTS is denying all access requests. We've lost administrator permissions and we do not have the ability to retake PRTS.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Kal'tsit?!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Finally, an answer!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Where are you? The Doctor and Amiya are coming over to help!
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: Bad news. PRTS is taking over all equipment on the ship, including the engines.
attributes.name: Closure

attributes.content: I know. I'm fighting for Rhodes Island's last chance.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Closure, warn the Doctor and Amiya—
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: She's waking up.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit
